text: Aldeburgh is a coastal town in the English county of Suffolk. It is on the Alde river. == Popular tourist attractions == Many people take a weekend trip to Aldeburgh. One of the main attractions is Moot Hall. Other attractions include a Napoleonic era defensive fort (known as a Martello tower), a sheltered yachting marina, and two Fish and chips shops == Other websites == * Welcome to Aldeburgh Category:Towns in Suffolk Category:Civil parishes in Suffolk Category:Suffolk Coastal
title: Aldeburgh
